column3: NACK.  Changing the behavior of VerifyScript in any detectable way is unacceptable, because of the risk of a blockchain fork.\n

This can't lead to a blockchain fork. These opcodes aren't on mainnet, and wouldn't be accepted on mainnet anyway by any existing client. They would be illegal before the change, and they would be illegal after the change. It only changes the behavior of a hypothetical client that relaxes IsStandard() script restrictions.\n

IsStandard() is not relevant to this discussion.  Transactions may appear in the blockchain, even if they fail IsStandard().

The set of acceptable behaviors is much larger than the set of relay-able IsStandard() behaviors.
